title: Dialogflow - Speech data logging
abstract:
# Dialogflow - Speech data logging
**    Beta     ** This product or feature is subject to the "Pre-GA Offerings Terms" in the General Service Terms section   of the [Service Specific Terms](/terms/service-terms#1) .     Pre-GA products and features are available "as is" and might have limited support.    For more information, see the [launch stage descriptions](/products#product-launch-stages) .
With Dialogflow Essentials, you can opt in to speech data logging to access [enhanced speech models](/dialogflow/es/docs/speech-enhanced-models) , which use customer data for speech recognition improvements.
content:
## Limitations
The following limitations apply:
- This setting is currently only available to users of a paid [edition](/dialogflow/docs/editions) .## Enabling data logging and using enhanced models
**Note:** Before enabling data logging, you need to certify that you have the proper permissions from the data originator(s), and that you haven't entered into a BAA with Google, for HIPAA purposes as an example. See the complete [terms for data logging](/dialogflow/docs/data-logging-terms) for details.
To enable data logging:
- Go to the [Dialogflow ES Console](https://dialogflow.cloud.google.com) .
- Select your agent.
- Click the settingsbutton next to the agent name to edit its settings.
- Select the **Speech** tab.
- Scroll to the **Improve Speech Recognition Quality** section.
- Toggle **Enable enhanced speech models and data logging** on.
To use an enhanced model, you just need to specify a speech model in your API request. If you do not specify a speech model, Dialogflow does not use an enhanced model.
## Disabling data logging
You can disable data logging for your project at any time. Review the [terms for data logging](/dialogflow/docs/data-logging-terms) to read about what happens to your data when you disable data logging for a project.
To disable data logging:
- Go to the [Dialogflow ES Console](https://dialogflow.cloud.google.com) .
- Select your agent.
- Click the settingsbutton next to the agent name to edit its settings.
- Select the **Speech** tab.
- Scroll to the **Improve Speech Recognition Quality** section.
- Toggle **Enable enhanced speech models and data logging** off.
